abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Guangxi Highway
            Project is to assist the Guangxi government to strengthen
            the local institutional capacity, and provide an efficient,
            safe and cost effective inter-provincial transport link
            among land-locked hinterland provinces of Guizhou, Yunnan,
            Sichuan and the city of Chongqing with Guangxi and the
            coastal province of Guangdong. During construction of the
            roads, noise pollution will be mitigated by resettlement,
            installation of noise barriers, and afforestation. To
            protect the landscape, detail alignment will be determined
            to minimize spots, volumes and areas of cutting limestone
            mountains. Restoration of vegetations will take place on all
            cutting sites. All plantable cutting slopes will be covered
            with turf. Because of the fact that the alignment goes along
            hilly and high areas with well developed vegetation, the
            construction will not have significant impact on the
            ecosystem along the road. Trees and grasses will be planted
            in the side slopes to reduce soil erosion. Temporary earth
            settlement tanks will be dug to catch runoff from
            excavation. To mitigate the impact of water pollution,
            sewerage treatment facilities will be set up at the service
            areas and toll stations. Culverts will be constructed for
            irrigation. To reduce air pollution, construction sites will
            be sprayed regularly. Wastewater will be treated and oil
            leakage from machinery will be collected and recycled.
